org.factcenter.qilin.primitives

Interface Group<G>

  • Type Parameters:
    G - the group element type
    All Superinterfaces:
    Sampler<G>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CyclicGroup<G>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ECGroup, Zn, Zpsafe, Zpstar

    public interface Group<G>
extends Sampler<G>
    Represents an algebraic Group with elements of a generic type. The group is defined generically so that pre-existing types can be used as the element (e.g., BigInteger). For our purposes, we require every group to be sampleable, hence this interface extends Sampler.

      • orderUpperBound

        java.math.BigInteger orderUpperBound()
        Get a bound on the order of the group. The actual order of the group MUST divide this bound (useful for choosing a random element of the group with a known discrete log)
        Returns:
        an upper bound on the order of the group

      • injectiveEncode

        G injectiveEncode(byte[] msg,
                  java.util.Random rand)
           throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Encode a message as a group element. This encoding must be injective and have an efficient decoder (see injectiveDecode(Object)). The encoding may be probabilistic (in which case it will use the supplied randomness). Note that the encoding may not be bijective -- not all group elements have a valid decoding.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be encoded. The message will be encoded as a getInjectiveEncodeMsgLength()}-byte message, if shorter it will be zero-padded at end, if longer truncated.
        Returns:
        The encoded message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the group doesn't support the encoding operation or if the message is too long.

      • injectiveDecode

        byte[] injectiveDecode(G encodedMsg)
                throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Decode a message encoded using injectiveEncode(byte[], Random).
        Parameters:
        encodedMsg -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • getInjectiveEncodeMsgLength

        int getInjectiveEncodeMsgLength()
                         throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns:
        the length (in bytes) of a message that can be encoded using the injectiveEncode(byte[], Random) method. Shorter messages will be zero-padded at the end, longer messages will be truncated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
